storyInfo: Vina confronts the dukes' provocation directly, reclaiming resources for the people of Londinium and formally declaring she will not become king. Meanwhile, the Glasgow Gang returns to Norport.

attributes.content: Vina... I don't like this story.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: The King who found no peace in his eternal rest upon the throne, and the hero who laid down her crown…
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: The story's over, but has anything really changed?
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: You and King Alistair both wanted to make Victoria better… but in the end…
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: Diane takes a hard swig from the bottle.
Cough—cough!
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: The burning liquor stings, coaxing more tears from her already swollen eyes.
If the King couldn't do it, then what hope do we have?
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: How can we possibly change anything?
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: But the story's not over yet, Diane.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I had also believed it would all end when the king found peace... but then someone unexpected appeared.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Should I even ask what brings you here?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: A white figure emerges from the shadows behind the throne.

attributes.text: 'Faint glimpses of that fairy can be seen in so many of Victoria's legends…'
'Power, intrigue, destiny, dreams coming true—throughout the centuries-old tales, she seems to possess different powers. Yet no one can say for certain which one is truly her.'

attributes.content: 'Vina, who did you see?'
Vina, you've far exceeded my expectations. You've shown me new possibilities.
Put down your hammer. I am not your enemy.
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: We fought side by side once, didn't we?
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: Who are you, Unicorn?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: A tailor's daughter, a leader of the Self-Salvation Corps, a witness to Victoria...
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: Of course, many old men, even as they faced death, insisted on calling me 'the Nation's Sentinel' in their history books. Wishful thinking, I suppose.
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: Over the hundreds of years I've remained in Victoria, I've assumed, and later erased, countless identities, but at present, I am Clovisia.
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: In short, I am your friend, one sincerely pleased by all you've achieved. Does this answer satisfy you, Vina?
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: Another one of the 'long-lived'? You deceived every ally in the Self-Salvation Corps, as well as all of Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Deceived? I've never deceived anyone. Everyone has their desires; I merely fulfill them.
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: Ordinary people tormented by Sarkaz bloodshed wanted to survive, so I led the Self-Salvation Corps to find a way out.
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: Ancient families, mired in power struggles, feared annihilation in the Empire's whirlpool, so I eliminated every threat to the continuation of the ducal lineage.
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: Frederick III hoped Victoria wouldn't fall into chaos beneath the Red Dragon's shadow—I could grant that wish, too.
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: So now you've come to me?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Alexandrina, daughter of Alistair, why would you think I'm only just noticing you now?
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: Vina, history is like a sailing ship, and you all are the ones who steer its course.
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: Since you wish to change Victoria, I can help you. What role would you assume to realize your ideals?
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: You could be a king, a speaker, or even the sole leader of The Exemplars—any of these titles are yours to choose.
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: 'Vina, I must say, yours isn't a new story. I've read far too many like it in old shops...'
'In the end, the hero always accepts the fairy's gift. So, in the end, you chose the role of speaker?'

attributes.text: 'For hundreds of years, the Unicorn has chosen the heroes, and the heroes have merely chosen their boons.'
'Yes, why did I have to choose her?'

attributes.content: Why are you laughing, Vina?
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: Do you hear that sound outside?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: They're cheering for victory, and for Victoria.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Many of them do not have grand ambitions. They don't think of protecting anyone. Some of them would not even share a piece of bread with a starving man.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Yet they are still willing to risk their lives for even the smallest sliver of hope. They are my 'Victoria'.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I like those fools, and I'm willing to look out for them.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: And you, Clovisia, have no right to make me choose something I've been doing all along.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: You'd best leave, unless you don't mind it getting awkward.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Siege!
You're a fool too, Alexandrina—just like your father.
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: Send them a message for me. Tell them the tailor's daughter is dead.
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: I have fulfilled their wishes.
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: Siege! I got the Crawler in here to back you up!
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: We've been waiting outside for you forever. We were afraid something happened to you.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: It's been taken care of. Thank you, Feist.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Come on then. Aren't they still all waiting for us? This battle must end now.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: That's the end of the story, Diane.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Diane?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: The condemned soldier has finished the last drop of alcohol and is sound asleep.
Diane wanted to drink herself into a stupor. Vina has finished telling her story, but Diane cannot bring herself to face her own ending.
She wanted to drink herself into a dream, a dream in which even death could not catch up to her. She gets her wish.
*sigh*
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I'm sorry, Diane. I am not worthy of being a monarch. I'm not even sure I'm qualified to serve as speaker.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Besides, this war has changed many things. Old beliefs have been shattered, and we are striving to rebuild our lives amidst the imminent threat of destruction.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I believe that soon, a great transformation will begin in Londinium and sweep across all of Victoria...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I don't know what tomorrow will bring, but I am certain of one thing: now that we've found the courage to face adversity, why should we ever return to the past?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Victoria no longer needs a monarch, Diane.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Sweet dreams.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: On the eve of her march to the gallows, the drunken soldier sleeps the most peaceful sleep of her life.

She dreams of the king's coronation. She dreams of the factory in her hometown, the whistle blowing to signal the end of the workday, as the workers shake off their hats and step out through the factory gates…
Then she soars into the sky and sees Londinium gliding across the mist-covered, verdant earth.
She dreams of Victoria. She is singing her song.

attributes.text: May the vast lands they keep owre kynge ♪
\n\nThen may we call and savely syng ♪

attributes.content: <p=1>Speaker's Office</><p=2>December 26th, 1098, 3:58 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: Vina, I can't believe it—the graffiti on the gym walls is still there! Look at this one—Morgan painted it after dreaming of being a famous artist.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Oh, right! Look at this photo—the sign on the movie theater has been nailed back up. And look, there are two dumb-looking fowlbeasts perched on top of it, haha.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Norport is in much better shape than the last time we saw it.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I can't wait to go back and see it with my own eyes.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Uh-huh...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: So, where did these photos come from?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: The envelope only had the photos, no signature. But plenty of people have joined the engineering team to help rebuild our home. Some of them are old friends from Norport.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Oh, there are two videotapes in here too. They're just some old, worn-out movies, but hey, Delphine, you love watching bad movies, don't you?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Here you go.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Vina... are you okay? You seem a bit distracted.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Are you all going back?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Why the serious look? We're just heading home early to do some housekeeping.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Morgan, you were more excited than anyone when we said we were going home... or am I missing something?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: How about you, Dagda?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I'll go lend them a hand. There's not much I can help with here, Vina.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: The Knights of the Tower Museum is coming along smoothly. My wish has been fulfilled.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Vina, actually, we could still—
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: The bell tolls.
It's 4:00. Vina...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I know... We can set out now.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Do you want to go see Diane?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: No, I have a meeting with Parliament and the dukes.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Oh...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Vina, those protesters outside—
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I'll handle them personally. I know their concerns go beyond just Diane—they've been waiting a long time for a king.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Ha, well, that's definitely something the Glasgow Gang can't meddle in.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Morgan...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Alright, alright. We'll head back and tidy up. You know, Norport is better than I expected—but not by much.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: We'll be waiting for you, Vina.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Vina, you could ask them to stay.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Of course, I'd love for the Glasgow Gang to stay together, but Auchterigg isn't their home.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Besides, just take a listen—there are plenty of people outside waiting for my response. But before I address them, I intend to bring back more than just empty promises from the dukes.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Vina, Parliament has done more than just make empty promises. They've helped revive our industries, restore order, resettle those affected by the war—
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Tell me, Delphine—does everyone now have an equal right to a decent life?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I need to show them that even without a king, we can prove this nation's potential to any doubters.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Let's go. I don't want to be late for the meeting with the dukes.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: We should sing something.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Sing what?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Any song will do, as long as it's not that blasted Auchterigg Carol.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Like the song Hannah hums every time she steps out of the ring? 'Hannah's a star, knocking 'em down, one by one, round after round♪'?
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Stuff it! I don't do that anymore!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Besides, didn't you all say the song I made up to cheer for Vina was better?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Oh, please. If I remember, you just replaced all the names in Dagda's favorite song with Vina, right?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I wonder if Vina even remembers something that silly.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Of course she does!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I know she mustn't have forgotten. It's just...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Forget it. She said it best herself: looking forward is what really matters.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: And there's still a long road ahead, isn't there?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.text: That day, we didn't take a detour to watch Diane's end, and we didn't listen to any radio broadcasts.
\nI heard her Oripathy was so bad that they had to separate her to prevent any incidents… To think that her last shred of dignity came from Oripathy.
\nI've stopped trying to make sense of these things. As we left Central Londinium and caught sight of the factories of Norport…

attributes.content: <p=1>The Sineselde, Parliamentary Chamber</><p=2>December 26th, 1098, 5:01 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: Vina, are you not attending the execution? They are relying on you to calm the many protesters there should things take an unfortunate turn.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: My good Earl of March, I'm not that indispensable. Besides, the Defense Forces are already maintaining order on-site, and several MPs are there to oversee the proceedings. They don't need me.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Diane Weber truly was a hero. Shame really. She didn't really do anything wrong.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Alexandrina, you've managed this matter well, but you need to be more heavy-handed.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: You're too concerned with dissenting voices, most of which don't matter.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Madam Speaker, why not let us shield you from the storm until Londinium's Parliament fully matures?
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Wellington's stance remains ambiguous, the Windermere demesne is simmering with unrest, and the Duke of Ashworth continues to keep a low profile as always.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: If the Speaker requires assistance, we wouldn't dare refuse. We must secure Victoria's future!
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Very well, since you've offered, I won't hesitate to accept.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Your Graces, you are undoubtedly aware of the dire situation with the Infected within the city. I must insist that you promptly reopen the supply route you have kept closed for over a month under the guise of ensuring safety.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Return the medicine and supplies we've already paid for. Of course, if you're still concerned, the Defense Forces can escort the shipment and clear out those 'bandits' along the way.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Of course, those are minor issues. Now, how about my proposal for forming and training Infected fighting squads?
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: I understand you're considering forming Infected units in your own territory and want us to test its feasibility. That's fine, but I insist that the safety of the soldiers remain a priority.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I'll make all the data available to you, of course, and to every other duke. After all, this has critical implications for the future strength of Victoria, doesn't it?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: This is no simple matter, Madam Speaker. In truth, it has given me quite a headache. I'll be waiting eagerly for some good news from you.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: As for Your Grace, Duke of Caster, the Trilby Ashers should soon be delivering an invitation.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: After all these years, Londinium will finally reopen diplomatic channels with foreign envoys—this time in the name of Victoria. I trust you all will be in attendance when the time comes.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: But you'd best pray that Londinium presents herself in a form you can be proud of.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I'll consider this a provocation, Alexandrina.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: From the moment you deliberately blocked Londinium from contacting other nations after the war, you've been provoking Parliament.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: You call it 'protection'. Where I'm from, we have another word for it—'kidnapping'.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Unfortunately for you, we always have our ways of reaching those whom we want.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Oh, Vina, is it my turn to negotiate now?
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: No, Earl of March. We have nothing to discuss, and certainly no need to be friends.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I'm afraid that's not for you to decide.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Hmph. Whatever your intentions may be, Londinium's affairs are none of Columbia's business.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: It seems you've found what you need to refuse any deals with me?
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: All I have is a few photos. Surely, you're aware of what's hidden beneath Londinium, right?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Vina, it seems you've managed to find yourself some leverage.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Alexandrina, I admire your candor. But I must remind you, you're the Speaker of Parliament now, not just some... street thug with the Glasgow Gang.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Well, do you know how we used to keep corrupt cops away back in Norport?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Either everyone pretends nothing happened and keeps things as they are, or we expose all their dirty laundry and everyone goes down in flames. It worked every time.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: And I'm sure your Graces understand that it has always been Victoria who has kept you safe, not the other way around. I believe your Grace has even said something of a similar nature before.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Alexandrina... I'm starting to doubt our decision of choosing you as Speaker.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: You're mistaken. The decision was mine all along, not yours.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I know your schedules are packed, so let's not digress anymore.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I have a long list of things to discuss with you, Parliament seats, medical purchases, military reform, private communication lines...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Supply routes, aid for reconstruction… so let's not waste time. Of course, you're free to continue arguing with me.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Don't worry, this time my sword won't be on your necks.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: She's coming! Everyone, get over here!
attributes.name: Agitated Citizen

attributes.content: If we can make the Speaker hear us, we can save that poor soldier's life.
attributes.name: Agitated Citizen

attributes.content: On the street, the eagerly awaiting crowd surrounds Vina, who stands alone.
She knows they are all waiting for her answer.
You've heard us! That innocent hero doesn't deserve this fate! It's not too late to change your mind!
attributes.name: Agitated Citizen

attributes.content: Sorry, I have nothing to say with regard to Diane.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: The Parliament has decided. As its Speaker, I stand by its decision.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Everyone, please disperse. Then again, if you absolutely insist on a resolution, you're welcome to stay.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Just now, I reclaimed many things from the visiting dukes—things that rightfully belonged to us and are crucial to our future.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I will tell you about each of these things, one by one. This is the only matter I'll be addressing.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: The sounds of protest begin to subside. While most await the outcome of the meeting, a few discontented voices still rise from the crowd.
Is there really nothing that can be done for that poor soul? But why?
attributes.name: Agitated Citizen

attributes.content: This isn't something that needs explaining. Do you want the Speaker to go back on her word?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: If we start bending the rules now, the new laws passed by Parliament won't be worth the paper they're printed on.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Catherine, what brings you here?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Some old friends passing by saw the protest and worried things might get out of hand, so they asked me to see if I could help.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: As luck would have it, quite a few workers just got off their shifts, heard about it, and came to support you.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Take a look.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: As more and more workers gather around, they wave at Vina and spot familiar friends and family members among the protesters.
Conversations begin to ripple through the crowd, and the street suddenly comes alive with activity.
Looks like we're a bit late.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Lieutenant?! Aren't you supposed to be waiting at the Sanatorium for your departure?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Delphine told me about your situation. I wasn't planning to come, but once the others at the Sanatorium found out, they insisted on coming to see who was causing you trouble this time.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: I couldn't stop them, so here we are.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: A column of soldiers, marching in perfect formation and singing, approaches the congested crowd.
The noise instantly dies down as people instinctively make way for the soldiers, who march up to stand in front of Vina, forming a barrier between her and the protesters.
Vina, we all know you went to negotiate with the dukes today, to fight for us.
attributes.name: Panting Soldier

attributes.content: We're not about to let you be humiliated in front of the dukes today!
attributes.name: Panting Soldier

attributes.content: We might not be ready for another battle, but we'll win anyone in numbers!
attributes.name: Panting Soldier

attributes.content: Thank you, all of you!
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Everyone, come quick! I think they're over there!
attributes.name: Curious Child

attributes.content: A group of rowdy children fearlessly push through the crowd, squeezing their way right up to Vina.
It's really you!
attributes.name: Curious Child

attributes.content: You know me?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Of course! We've all heard your story. The great hero of the Exemplars, our very own Speaker!
attributes.name: Curious Child

attributes.content: I've made so many new friends recently—they're all people who walked back to Londinium with you.
attributes.name: Curious Child

attributes.content: They told me you would definitely recognize them. Take a look.
attributes.name: Curious Child

attributes.content: H-Hello, Vina?
attributes.name: Timid Child

attributes.content: Annie? And there's Anabella! Oh, Jones! You're here too!
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I guess they were telling the truth then!
attributes.name: Curious Child

attributes.content: But... Why have you come?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: We ran into this lady with really tan skin. She said you might run into trouble and told us to come help you!
attributes.name: Curious Child

attributes.content: Uh... did we actually help?
attributes.name: Curious Child

attributes.content: Of course you did!
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Thank you, Morgan.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: More and more people gather in front of the steps, while those who had been protesting for Diane start to quiet down.
Sigh... whew—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: She thinks about everything that has happened over the past few days.
She thinks about the drunken Diane, the departing Glasgow Gang, and the stolen crown.
Bloody hell...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Vina relaxes, sitting down on the steps and gazing at the fiery red sky.
The retired soldiers sit as well, huddling with the other citizens around Vina.
Ha, let's all take a break, okay?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Can I ask you something?
attributes.name: Curious Child

attributes.content: Will we ever have a king again?
attributes.name: Curious Child

attributes.content: I don't know, but not having a king might not be such a bad thing.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Why is that?
attributes.name: Curious Child

attributes.content: You'll understand when you grow up.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Curious Child

attributes.content: What do you think—will this be good or bad for Victoria?
attributes.name: Uncertain Worker

attributes.content: It's still too early to tell.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: If we have to accept the dawn of a new era, then we all need to change the way we think to keep up.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: A Parliament regulated by the people, no more individual authority, no king… that's a first in Victorian history.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Even I have to admit, she may well be biting off more than she can chew.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Catherine glances at the Speaker, who is sitting on the steps without her expected grace, and can't help but wonder.
Vina is surrounded by the children. They all smile and laugh together.
Every so often, she raises her voice to share jokes about the dukes or what she managed to wrestle from the dukes. Things that belonged to the people.
The sunset's warm light bathes her figure, before slowly fading as the time passes.
I'd say the days ahead will only get better.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: She breathes out a ring of smoke, watching as the thin wisps drift away into the dying light.
Parliament has passed a resolution: The crown will be placed on the throne in the Palace of Westhaleg, guarded around the clock by the Defense Forces.
attributes.name: Citywide Broadcast

attributes.content: Until a suitable candidate for the throne is identified, the Crown will be guarded by Parliament.
attributes.name: Citywide Broadcast

attributes.content: Once a candidate is chosen, a nationwide referendum will be conducted under Parliamentary review and supervision to finalize the coronation.
attributes.name: Citywide Broadcast

attributes.content: Additionally, Parliament will soon announce decisions regarding the distribution of living supplies and other public welfare matters—
attributes.name: Citywide Broadcast

attributes.content: Ha, Parliamentary supervision.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: These meetings are truly exhausting. I much prefer settling matters at a grand banquet.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: At least there's wine when my lips are parched. *sigh* Sir Davis is certainly taking his sweet time fetching the wine.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Your Grace, Duke of Caster, where are you headed next?
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: You already know the answer, so why pretend to ask?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Getting the news from you is quicker than waiting for Wellington's spies to report back.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: So how about you, Eleanor?
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Your Grace, we're hardly close enough to be exchanging warm farewells.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Your words wound me, Eleanor. I suppose I'll have to present a fine bottle of wine on my next visit to old Normandy and ask him to put in a good word about me to you.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Your carriage has arrived, sir. Allow me to get the door for you.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Much obliged, Earl of March.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: And remember, we are all Victorians, after all.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Ah, it's been so long since I last heard these bells. The sound brings back memories.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Your Grace, I've brought you one of the finest wines from our cellar!
attributes.name: Adulating Noble

attributes.content: Even those Sarkaz devils couldn't sniff this one out after they took my estate.
attributes.name: Adulating Noble

attributes.content: Sir Davis, you are a man of rare wit.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Rest assured, there will always be a place for you in the Gododdin territories.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: The Duke of Gododdin takes a sip of the wine and turns to make a remark, but then suddenly freezes.
He is confronted with a stunning sight—
...The sun has set...
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: The crimson sun sinks slowly, as though setting the entire city ablaze.
The scars the Sarkaz had torn into the city stand out even more vividly in the evening glow, as if they are still bleeding.
(Sneezes) The winter sunset truly shows no mercy.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Ah, much like the Speaker's attitude toward us, I suppose.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: I could send someone to deliver a few sets of winter clothing for Your Grace.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Take care of yourself—Victoria isn't ready to do without you just yet.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Many thanks.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: After all, we can't very well go before Wellington, can we?
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Why the sudden melancholy, Your Graces?
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: I find this sunset rather breathtaking.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Day fades into night, and night into day—how often do we get to witness such a sight?
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Londinium's thick fog and heavy clouds rarely part like this.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Eleanor, back in the day, the lads at school would always joke that it was the sun that had to follow behind Londinium.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: It would rise as we please, and never set if we willed it.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Now, though, she has to go full speed just to barely keep up with the setting sun.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: That thought keeps me awake at night.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Day or night, sunrise or sunset, only Londinium can be Victoria's capital.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Earl of March, remember my words.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Droll. Very droll indeed.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Hah, the sun really does move.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Another bell tolls.
More black-feathered fowlbeasts stir and take to the skies over the city, circling before flying through the steam towards the setting sun.
As the sun dips out of sight, the glow of the twin moons becomes ever clearer.
Night approaches.
